Reviews.Title: “Gilding the Turd.”
Reviews.Author: artd67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location and it's public areas are tolerable, if poorly finished. That's the good news. This however, will not prepare you for the disgrace that is room 206, should you be unfortunate enough to stay here. Firstly, you must understand that the first five of the seven floors are designated as 'Smoking'. Something that the mostly non European clientele embrace to the fullest extent. The room stank worse than one of Keith Richards' ashtrays and had more burn marks on the furnishings than I have ever seen in one room. The smell of cigarettes would have been overpowering were it not for the stench of mould, mildew and damp.The plaster and wallpaper had long ago given up trying to stay in place, with even the framed pictures on the wall curled up. The furnishings were mostly broken and/or held together with protruding screws. There was a mini fridge, 'dumped' on the rancid carpet, complete with broken door and exposed wires. The worst part though, filth aside, is that the smoke alarm was disabled. it's innards gutted, removed, gone! PLEASE CONSIDER THE FOLLOWING: any hotel management team that allows smoking in 80% of it's bedrooms, has numerous unprotected electrical cables and actively promotes/tolerates the disablement of smoke alarms, is risking more than one life. An inexpensive hotel? At what cost?

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel at best location”
Reviews.Author: Misterymm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The only good thing was that we didn't spend much time inside and went out to see the city. The only thing you shouldn't do is look at the pictures in their website, because they make fake impression on people. Food was bad, considering that Turkish cuisine is one of the richest in the world. It was kind of clean, but the beds were really bad based on spring. The stuff was nice, but it is not a big deal in Turkey, cause providing good service there is kind of common thing. The elevator didn't work properly and cleaning ladies were settling the room so that you couldn't find anything later.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asmaa d
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a whole week, during July 2011. The staff were very helpful. First we were given a room at the ground floor, with no view at all; but when I complained, they changed it with another room in the third floor. Breakfast is very good. Although it's the same every day, but you won't get bored, or hungry :). It is close to the 'Besiktas' bus station, and the 'Bosphorus'.The only bad thing is that it is located on a high hill, we had to take a taxi to go up the street, but only paid 4 TL each time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go - it's a shocker”
Reviews.Author: pamela787
Reviews.Content: Was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Stained carpet, peeling wallpaper, skirting boards that haven't been painted in 30 years, frig not working,black mould around most of tiles in the bathroom. Bathroom door didn't close properly. I had read the bad reports, and had Flight Centre Knox check with Adventure World/Neon tours and was assured that this Hotel was suitable for 2 ladies in their 60's. It was a disgrace and i cannot believe that a Tour company would suggest it. Most staff were helpful, particularly Happy ,the Porter. The Hotel is in quite a good position (but so are many others). Taslik Hotel is on a VERY steep hill which wouldn't suit most people.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: LuciaMalta
Reviews.Content: This is a depressing place to stay. Very basic. The "superior" rooms are not even equal to a cheap standard room in a bad hotel. (The standard rooms at the Taslik are like box rooms in the basement - look through the window and you see a wall). The only redeeming feature in the superior room was that the bed was quite comfortable. No tea or coffee facilities, stained carpets, horrible breakfast and all at an unreasonably high price. You need to be able to walk up and down hills, so not suitable for some people. I would not reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I hope I would live this hotel again soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: JinyiChen
Reviews.Content: The location of Taslik Hotel is good. I can walk to taksim square or walk to see the Bosphorous. The clearness of my single room is also good. The most important thing is the staffs are friendly. I LOVE their service and cheerful greetings. I hope they would be there when I live in the hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “far from what I've expected”
Reviews.Author: Payam_Vakil
Reviews.Content: I know Istanbul very well and I knew that Besiktas is a great neighbor, far from the crowd. But the hotel itself wasn't what I've expected at all, the furniture is old, rooms are not clean. I'm sure with half of this money you could find a better place!! I also have to mention that staff are very friendly and helpful and the neighbor is very safe. I payed $11 for internet service!!! It's speed was acceptable but I could only connect with one device simultaneously

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 4peterkh4
Reviews.Content: Little dirty... Old... Furniture break at first touch... Friends got SAND in shower water But the staff are friendly and speak fluent English, and the food is ok

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1TEXAS1
Reviews.Content: The Taslik is not in an area for tourists but is in a very safe area. No matter which street or alley I went down, no matter the time of day or night, I always felt safe. If you are going to Istanbul for 2 or 3 days I would stay in a different area. I was there 3 weeks on a business trip so the location was perfect for me. I walked 5 minutes to get to public transportation which allowed me to go anywhere for about $1.20 US. The hotel offers free breakfast and has a dining room for lunch and dinner. The staff was great and I probably talked to them at length almost everyday about sites to see, cost, and the best way to get there. When I travel I enjoy doing things as the locals would do them. The hotel lobby and restaurant is well kept and clean. There is a computer for guests and wifi is available in your room, just ask the front desk to turn it on for you. The rooms are very dated and have no frills. Most of the guests are business men who need to be in that area of town. The cost for that area of town is average and you can easily go down the street to the W but expect to pay almost triple the rate. If you plan to spend a good amount of time in your room, I would probably look elsewhere. As most facilities in Istanbul are, nothing is handicap friendly in this hotel or anything nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here”
Reviews.Author: Max2011
Reviews.Content: This is a dreadful hotel. Im sure at some point in the past this was a decent hotel, but they really have let things go. The rooms are not clean. We noticed that dust was falling from one of the holes in the ceiling. The corridors are dark and dingy. This hotel feels more like a prison. Finally the breakfast is discusting. No variety, same stuff every day. they only do two cooked things, warmed up tim of sausages and boiled eggs!! worst of all i noticed that they were serving Oranges that had gone off!!! eat here if you wana get ill! Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “The most dirty,disgusting hotel with lazy and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: zeyzeyzey
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel to stay. It even does not deserve one star. Never ever stay in this hotel if you want to have good time in Istanbul. Nothing good in this hotel. U can not sleep because of fleas. One can easily get ill because of germs.

Reviews.Title: “Taslik Hotel Istanbul Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Leesytuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Taslik hotel on 2 occassions, firstly for 5 days and then for 3 days before the commencement of my Cosmos tour and after tour. The location was a little out of the way but I was able to jump on and off public transport quite easily and get to most places.( I was not ready for the squash early in the morning!! Breathing was an option at one stage). The walk up the hill after a long day was a killer. Supermarket directly opposite was great. The hotel rooms were very average, tired, needed a refurb and a good clean. I did not expect it to be palacial but I did expect it to be clean. It was not. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was uncleaned.Carpet felt grotty under bare feet and bathroom floor was not vaccummed or mopped the entire time I stayed. Television reception was either non existant or with bad interferance with the english speaking channels. After several attempts to fix TV I gave up asking for it to be fixed-I actually believe I was fobbed off. Given it was the first impression of my tour and the last, I do think Cosmos could have chosen better. Resturant meal was reasonable, quick and affordable. I in all honesty can not recommend the Taslik to stay in and I hope Cosmos will re think accomdation in Istanbul in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “The Taslik had unacceptable conditions and very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: dmkotz
Reviews.Content: The room had a powerful mildew smell coming from a soaking wet carpet in the corner of the room, but they refused our request for a room change. We discovered the wet spot was caused by a steadily leaking air conditioner. We told several desk clerks about this, but none did anything or even seemed interested in the problem -- we had to make do with putting a bucket under the air conditioner. The desk staff ranged from rude to downright nasty. When I checked out, they levied a big charge for renting a clothes iron. I said we had not used one, but they insisted we had -- since my wife was not present when I checked out, I thought maybe she had used one. After I later checked with my wife, I found it had been an invented charge. This hotel should be closed by the authorities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but worn out”
Reviews.Author: 1whereintheworldami1
Reviews.Content: I am sure this was once a good business hotel. Unfortunately they have not renovated the rooms in ages. The 80's style has come and gone and low maintenance quality does not help. Currently there is a high rise being built behind so noise is a problem. It seems like they are booking the place with packaged tours. The Location is amazing, very desirable, I just wish the owners would make an investment into their business.

Reviews.Title: “cleanliness level wouldn't rate even one star”
Reviews.Author: PlatoOtaki
Reviews.Content: Stayed there before and after a Cosmos tour. The tour itself was great, but this disgusting hotel was the worst during two weeks of travel. The staff are very helpful but the owners seem to have no interest in the concept of "clean". Cosmos and other travellers should look for the many other great options available in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and very close to all”
Reviews.Author: happysenior4
Reviews.Content: we were there 3 nights. 1 before cosmos tour started & then 2 at end of tour. We found rooms very large and clean. The food was very good both for breakfast and also for dinner. We also found 1 italian rest. within 1 block that was one of the best italian rest I have ever eaten at and very inexpensive!!!! Overall I would highly recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: emrekarakurt
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay at this hotel for a few days with my girlfriend. We checked in daytime and it was a weekday. The hotel is at the center of a very popular location named Nisantasi, so you are very close to any kind of shopping or dining places. The housekeeping was fast and effective, and during our stay since we spent most of the time in our room, we used room service a lot, which was also fast, elegant and delicious. I assume that this hotel is also used by many businessman which we happened to see at the hotel during our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially if you are looking for a quiet hotel for leisure, but also close to the social life centers.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good location...”
Reviews.Author: roleycsl
Reviews.Content: Our stay will include over 15 days, due to medical reasons. We find the staft to be very accomodating and helpful. On our first day, they changed out our mattress due to my medical needs and from that point on they have been extremly helpful. The morning breakfast is typcial for Instanbul, breads, cheeses, veggies, soup, ceral, yogurt., juices, and hot tea! The hotel is older like some of the other postings mention and could use some "cosmetic repairs". 10-15 minutes to shopping, restuants, and the ferry's. Overall a pleasant experience:) Two ATM's and local pharmacy within 25 meters. Excellent Italian, India, and local resturant's with in the block. Taxi's readily available on the street, Overall rating "B":)

Reviews.Title: “Fairly central but in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Dugb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Taslik at the beginning and at the end of a Turkish tour, threee nights in all. Our room was on the second floor at the back of the hotel and was in need of updating. The paintwork in the bedroom was peeling and the wall covering was old, and heavily marked. The bathroom paintwork was peeling also and the wood around doorlock was damaged, exposing the lock. The taps to the handbasin were very stiff and nearly imposible to turn on and off withou using some force. The metal door to the balcony had mulitple locking points, but they were distorted leaving only a quite flimsy single locking point operated by the handle. Although on the second floor, the balcony was easily accessable from the fire escape. The power outlets were loose and the cover on one was detached, also, the bedhead lights could not be operated from the bed, the switch was at the entrance door. The staff were helpful and the breakfasts were fine, we used the restaurant for an evening meal twice - on the night we arrived and on the final night. We had the Chicken and Thyme both times, on the first occasion it was very nice, on the second it was dry, gristly and aweful, my wife suggested that it had been run over by a bus. The hotel offered Wi-Fi, but made a chargeof 10 lira for two days to have it in your room - a bit steep when other hotels we used offered it free.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnosha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taslik hotel for two weeks in one of their so called Executive rooms overlooking a building site, the room smelled of smoke and the safe deposit was broken, we asked to change room and was told that we could change the next day and to pack our cases and they would move them to the new room when we got back to the hotel at 5.30pm we were told that we could not move until the next day. Our new room was on the ground floor, which again had a strong smell of smoke, when we opened the window there were about 10 stray cats which used area for their toilet the smell was unbeleivable. We again changed room after a few days as no other room was available, this was a better room but our window was on the courtyard where sometimes 15 of the hotel staff smoked, if the window was open it came into the bedroom. The staff were unfriendly and so unhelpful,the buffet breakfast was the same for 2 weeks with hard boiled eggs every day if you wanted a fried egg they charged you 4TL and coffee was from Nescafe sachets. Also BEWARE OF USING THE COFFEE AND T BAGS IN YOUR ROOM AS THEY CHARGE YOU 4TL FOR TEA AND 5 TL FOR COFFEE AT THE END OF OUR STAY THEY WANTED NEARLY Â£100 FOR TEA AND COFFEE WHICH i HAVE MEVER EXPERIENCED IN ANY OTHER HOTEL I HAVE STAYED IN. When in Istanbul the taxi drivers try to rob you, we had a taxi and the charge was 6TL I gave the driver a 10 TL note which he put in his pocket and then insisted I had given him a 5TL note and wanted another 1TL. Restaurants in Taxim Square will also try to overcharge so beware. John & Natasha England

Reviews.Title: “mid range hotel in classy area”
Reviews.Author: oscar28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a two week long trek through Turkey with COSMOS Tours. It is a hotel in an up market district which is not very central, and it is almost on top of a steep hill so may not be convenient for some, definitely not for wheel-chairs. However, it is conveniently opposite a supermarket and also near to some nice restaurants if you care to explore on foot. It is also walking distance from the jetty Besiktas Our flight arrived at 6am so it was reasonable to have to wait till 9am before they found a clean room to check into. The hotel is quite functional and has two tiny lifts which are efficient but a bit scary for some (no doors so you see brickwork between floors). The lounge area is small with a restaurant built into the basement. Restaurant serves reasonable breakfast if your expectation is simple continental breakfast. Real omelettes and fresh juices cost extra, at least for our tour group. The room we had for 3 days were reasonably large and facing the quiet side of the hotel. Road noise can be a problem for rooms facing the front as the road is paved with cobble stone and is quite busy. Rooms are clean and facilities are reasonable. We were quite satisfied with the room and general services including the wireless internet. However, some doubtful arrangements happened on the day of departure:- we booked a taxi an hour before we depart but it was late for almost 10 minutes, yet the huge taxi stand by the park is only 3 minutes walk from the hotel. I doubt we will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical middle of the range city hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: madeleinetarling
Reviews.Content: Paint still peeling in bedrooms (see previous reports) Rooms comfortable -breakfast choice limited. Not very good first impressions but staff were SO helpful.The administration staff were really excellent. They let me use the computer in their office and when my task took about half an hour instead of five minutes they remained friendly and helpful and made me tea . All the office staff and reception staff deserve to be considered for employee of the month. The doorman was also particularly helpful so despite first impressions I would happily use the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Okay, with tasty food”
Reviews.Author: JacqiB
Reviews.Content: This was the first and the last hotel on my organised tour of Turkey (Archers/Cosmos). Istayed in two different (but identical) rooms The bed was comfy, the room was clean and quite roomy for a city hotel. The bathroom was clean but the bathroom door in both rooms had peeling paint at the bottom - it rather looked as though there had been a flood there. There is a small supermarket directly opposite where you can buy bottled water, juice, biscuits, etc (but walk up the road a little to the crossing - even though this is a one-way street, the traffic is dangerous). The Dolmabace Palace (closed Thursdays) is just down the (very steep) hill but for all other tourist sights you will need to travel a little way. either take a taxi (between 7-14 TL) or walk about 15 minutes along the main road at the bottom of the hill to the tram terminus and take the tram into the centre. You need to buy a token from the kiosk at the tram entrance. This costs less than 2TL. The breakfast was so-so but the food available from the restaurant was good. I had the lamb shish kebab and the meat was suculent and the veggies fresh. Staff were friendly and helpful. I can't comment on the price as it was part of my package so I have no figures.

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst hotel i've ever stayed in ever, and we do travel a lot.”
Reviews.Author: EmanKasasbeh
Reviews.Content: It actually effected the way i saw bueatiful istanbul in a negative way. First they took us to a room full of smoke & we did ask for a non-smoker room. until we insisted we have it changed. When we had it changed the new room as we were told was a good one: 1st most important there was no saftey box & they charge you at the reception for one. 2nd A bath room tawols had somthing yellow on it!!! 3rd Hair on the bath room floor and obvesely not ours. 4rd room serves is ZERO & room cleaning was bad. 5th our guide left us a message at the reception, we didnt understand it so we lost our trip the next day. We talked to the manger about it and we were totally ignored ...

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel at bad location”
Reviews.Author: matakan
Reviews.Content: we were a; group of football supporters around 16 person for an football match in istanbul... hotel was very old and a little bit dirty... bath was very older and damaged... bads are comfortable and mini bar was very rich and cheap... the location of the hotel is very form to the tourist areas; like taksim, topkapi....etc... transportation facilities are very weak at the hotel area... around that hotel its not easy to find nice restaurants or any fastfood restaurants... in my oppinion that hotel must be suitable for business persons... no way for tourists...

HotelInfo.Name: Taslik Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Suleyman Seba 75 | Validecesme, Istanbul 34357, Turkey
